translation: (640) It was then that the Bhagavān addressed Venerable Ānanda, saying, This is the country of Mathurā, where there will be children of merchants in the future.

source_sentence: 名曰掘多，掘多有子，名優波掘多，我滅度後百歲，當作佛事，於教授師中最為第一。
translation: He had a son named Upagupta. One hundred years after my parinirvāṇa he will do buddha-work and be the foremost among all his teachers.

source_sentence: 阿難！

translation: Do you see that blue-colored jungle from a distance?

source_sentence: 阿難白佛：「唯然，已見。

translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 是處名為優留曼茶山，如來滅後百歲，此山當有那吒跋置迦阿蘭若處，
translation: This place will be called Urumaṇḍa Mountain. One hundred years after the parinirvāṇa of the Tathāgata, there will be a buddha-field called Naṭapālīka Arraṇī on this mountain.

source_sentence: 此處隨順寂默最為第一。」
translation: This place is the first in terms of following silence.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊作是念：「我若以教法付囑人者，恐我教法不得久住；
translation: At that time the World-honored One had this thought: If I were to entrust the teachings to others, I am afraid that my teachings would not endure for long.

source_sentence: 若付囑天者，恐我教法亦不得久住，世間人民則無有受法者。
translation: If someone were to entrust it to the gods, they're afraid that my teaching won't be able to stay long, and there wouldn't be anyone among the people in the world who receive the teaching.

source_sentence: 我今當以正法付囑人、天，諸天、世人共攝受法者，我之教法則千歲不動。」
translation: Now, I will entrust the right teaching to humans and gods, gods and worldly people who take it in common with me, and my teaching will remain unmoving for a thousand years.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊起世俗心。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān had a worldly mind.

source_sentence: 時，天帝釋及四大天王知佛心念，來詣佛所，稽首禮足，退坐一面。
translation: Knowing the Buddha’s thoughts, Indra and the four great deva kings came to the place where the Buddha was staying. Having paid respect with their heads at his feet, they withdrew and sat to one side.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告天帝釋及四大天王：「如來不久當於無餘涅槃而般涅槃，
translation: It was then that the World-honored One said to Indra and the four great celestial kings: Soon, the Tathāgata will enter nirvana without remainder.

source_sentence: 我般涅槃後，汝等當護持正法。」
translation: After I pass into nirvāṇa, you will guard the right teaching.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊復告東方天王：「汝當於東方護持正法。」
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān again addressed the eastern celestial king, You must protect the right teaching in the east.

source_sentence: 次告南方、西方、北方天王：「汝當於北方護持正法。
translation: Next, he told the god kings of the south, west, and north, You must protect the right teaching in the north.

source_sentence: 過千歲後，我教法滅時，當有非法出於世間，十善悉壞。
translation: After a thousand years, when my teaching ceases, there will be an unlawful thing that emerges from the world and all the ten good qualities will perish.

source_sentence: 閻浮提中，惡風暴起，水雨不時，世多飢饉，雨則災雹，江河消滅，華果不成，
translation: In Jambudvfpa there is a bad wind that blows violently and unseasonably. There is neither water nor rain at the proper time, and hunger and thirst are prevalent in the world. When it rains thunderstorms and hailstorms occur, all the rivers and streams pass away without producing any flower or fruit.

source_sentence: 人無光澤，蟲村鬼村悉皆磨滅，飲食失味，珍寶沈沒，人民服食麁澁草木。
translation: The people lack the luster and splendor, and all the villages of insects and ghosts are completely decayed; food and drink lose their flavor. Precious treasures sink into oblivion and the people eat grass and trees that grow perched on them.

source_sentence: 「時，有釋迦王、耶槃那王、鉢羅婆王、兜沙羅王，眾多眷屬。
translation: “At the time, there was King Śākyamuni, King Yavana, King Prabhāvarī, and King Tuṣara with many members of their retinues.

source_sentence: 如來頂骨、佛牙、佛鉢安置東方。
translation: The Tathāgata's topknot bone, the Buddha's tooth relic, and the Buddha's bowl were placed in the east.

source_sentence: 西方有王，名鉢羅婆，百千眷屬，破壞塔寺，殺害比丘。
translation: In the western direction there was a king named Benares, with hundreds of thousands of attendants who destroyed stupas and temples and killed monks.

source_sentence: 北方有王，名耶槃那，百千眷屬，破壞塔寺，殺害比丘。
translation: To the north, there was a king named Yavana with hundreds of thousands of followers who destroyed stūpas and temples and killed monks.

source_sentence: 南方有王，名釋迦，百千眷屬，破壞塔寺，殺害比丘。
translation: In the south, there was a king named Śākyamuni with a hundred thousand members of his retinue who destroyed stūpas and temples and killed monks.

source_sentence: 東方有王，名兜沙羅，百千眷屬，破壞塔寺，殺害比丘。
translation: To the east was a king named Tuṣara, with hundreds of thousands of followers who destroyed stupas and temples and killed monks.

source_sentence: 四方盡亂，諸比丘來集中國。
translation: The four directions were completely disturbed, and the monks came to assemble in China.

source_sentence: 「時，拘睒彌國有王，名摩因陀羅西那，其王生子，手似血塗，身似甲冑，
translation: “At that time in the kingdom of Kauśāmbī there was a prince named Māyindharasena. The prince gave birth to a son, whose hands looked like blood smeared on their bodies and whose body looked like armor.

source_sentence: 有大勇力。
translation: He has great courage and strength.

source_sentence: 其生之日，五百大臣生五百子，皆類王子，血手冑身。
translation: On the day of his birth, five hundred ministers gave birth to five hundred sons, all of whom were princes with bloody hands and armor bodies.

source_sentence: 「時，拘睒彌國，一日雨血。
translation: “At the time, one day it rained blood in Kauśāmbī.

source_sentence: 拘睒彌王見此惡相，即大恐怖，請問相師。
translation: Seeing these bad signs, the king of Kauśāmbī was greatly frightened and asked the soothsayer.

source_sentence: 相師白王：『王今生子，當王閻浮提，多殺害人，生子七日，字曰難當，
translation: The soothsayer said to the king, “Your majesty, my lord, I am about to become king of Jambudvfpa. Seven days have passed since you gave birth to my seventh child, named Nandika.

source_sentence: 年漸長大。
translation: He grew up gradually.

source_sentence: 時，四惡王從四方來殺人民，摩因陀羅西那王聞則恐怖。』
translation: When the four evil kings came from the four directions to kill people, King Mahāprajāpaṇa was frightened when he heard it.'

source_sentence: 「時，有天神告言：『大王且立難當為王，足能降伏彼四惡王。』
translation: At the time, a celestial deity told him, 'The great king, let's make it difficult to become king, and his feet will be able to subdue those four bad kings.'

source_sentence: 時，摩因陀羅西那王受天神教，即捨位與子，以髻中明珠冠其子首，集諸大臣，
translation: At that time, having been instructed by heavenly deities, King Mahāprajāsena gave up his throne to his son and placed the precious pearl in his topknot over his prince’s head.

source_sentence: 香水灌頂。
translation: It's a fragrant consecration of perfume.

source_sentence: 召五百大臣同日生子，身被甲冑，從王出征，與四惡王大眾戰；
translation: He summoned the five hundred ministers and gave birth to his son on the same day. His body armored with armor, he came out of the king’s palace to battle against the four evil kings.

source_sentence: 勝，殺害都盡，王閻浮提，治在拘睒彌鞞國。」
translation: He won, killing all of them, and the king of Jambudvīpa ruled in the country of Kauśāmbī.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告四大天王：「巴連弗國，於彼國當有婆羅門，名曰阿耆尼達多，
translation: At that time the World-honored One said to the four great celestial kings, “In the country of Paribhūta there will be a brahman named Agnidatta in that country.

source_sentence: 通達比陀經論，彼婆羅門當納妻。
translation: He understood that the sūtras and treatises of the Abhidharma-sūtra taught that those brāhmaṇas would accept their wives.

source_sentence: 彼時，中陰眾生當來與其作子，入母胎中時，彼母欲與人論議。
translation: At the time, intermediate beings in the intermediate existence will give birth to their future offspring and when they enter their mother's womb, that mother wants to have a discussion with someone.

source_sentence: 彼婆羅門即問諸相師，相師答云：『是胎中眾生當了達一切論，故令母生如是論議之心，
translation: The brāhmaṇa asked the soothsayers, “Those who are born in the womb should understand all theories and therefore cause their mothers to give rise to such thoughts of debate.

source_sentence: 欲將人論議。』
translation: I want to discuss it with someone.'

source_sentence: 如是日月滿足，出生母胎，以為童子，了達一切經論，恒以經論教授五百婆羅門子，
translation: Thus, when the sun and moon were full, he was born in his mother’s womb as a small child comprehending all scriptures and treatises. He always taught the five hundred brahman children by means of scriptures and treatises.

source_sentence: 及餘諸論教授餘人，以醫方教醫方者，如是有眾多弟子。
translation: Those who teach others in other treatises and those who teach others with a doctor's prescription using a doctor's prescription, such are the many disciples.

source_sentence: 有眾多弟子故，名曰弟子。
translation: Because there are so many disciples, they're called disciples.

source_sentence: 次當從父母求出家學道，乃至父母聽其出家，彼即於我法中出家學道，
translation: Next, you should seek renunciation from your parents and train in the path. Even if their parents allow you to renounce household life, they will renounce household life because of my teaching and study the path.

source_sentence: 通達三藏，善能說法，辯才巧妙，言語談說，攝多眷屬。」
translation: He comprehends the Tripiṭaka, is good at teaching the Dharma, has eloquence and skillfulness, speaks words and talks well, and has many followers.

source_sentence: 又復，世尊告四大天王：「即此巴連弗邑國中，當有大商主，名曰須陀那，
translation: Again, the World-honored One said to the four great celestial kings: “In the country of Paranirmita-vaśavartin there will be a great merchant named Sudhana.

source_sentence: 中陰眾生來入母胎。
translation: Sentient beings in the intermediate aggregate come into their mother's womb.

source_sentence: 彼眾生入母胎時，令母質直柔和，無諸邪想，諸根寂靜。
translation: When those sentient beings enter their mother's womb, they cause the mother to be straightforward and gentle, have no wrong thoughts, and have calm faculties.

source_sentence: 「時，彼商主即問相師，相師答曰：『胎中眾生極為良善，故令母如是，
translation: The merchant leader then asked the soothsayer, “The sentient beings in the womb are so good-natured that they cause their mothers to be like this.

source_sentence: 乃至諸根寂靜。』
translation: ... and even the faculties are quiescent.'

source_sentence: 至月滿足，便生童子，名曰修羅他。
translation: When the moon was full, a boy named Shurota gave birth to him.

source_sentence: 年紀漸長，乃至啟白父母，求出家學道。
translation: As his age grew, he told his parents to leave home and study the Way.

source_sentence: 父母即聽，於我法中出家學道，勤行精進，修習道業，便得漏盡，證阿羅漢果。
translation: Their parents then listened and renounced the householder’s life to study the path in accordance with my teaching. They diligently practiced, exerted themselves energetically, and cultivated the deeds of the path. Then they attained cessation of the influence of defilement and realized arhatship.

source_sentence: 然寡聞、少欲、知足及少知，舊居在山藪林間，山名揵陀摩羅。
translation: However, they are not well-versed, have few desires, are content and do not know much. Formerly they lived in a mountain forest where the mountain was called Gandhamāla.

source_sentence: 「時，彼聖人恒來為難當王說法。
translation: “At the time, that sage always came to teach the Dharma for King Nandika.

source_sentence: 彼父王當無常，無常之日，難當見父過世，兩手抱父屍，悲號啼哭，憂惱傷心。
translation: That father, king, will become impermanent. On the day of impermanence it will be difficult for him to see his father pass away. He embraced his father’s corpse with both hands and cried aloud in sorrow, grieving and distressed.

source_sentence: 時，彼三藏將多眷屬來詣王所，為王說法，王聞法已，憂惱即止，於佛法中生大敬信，
translation: Then the Tripitaka Master, accompanied by a large group of his followers, came to the king and preached the Dharma to him. Having heard the Dharma, the king was grieved and remained there. He had great respect and faith in the buddha-dharma.

source_sentence: 而發聲唱言：『自今以後，我施諸比丘無恐畏，適意為樂。』
translation: He then raised his voice and called out, 'From now on, I'll give to the monks without fear and make them happy according to their wishes.'

source_sentence: 而問比丘：『前四惡王毀滅佛法有幾年歲？』
translation: He asked the monk, 'How many years have passed since the four previous bad kings disparaged the Buddha's teaching?'

source_sentence: 諸比丘答云：『經十二年。』
translation: The monks replied, 'Twelve years have passed.'

source_sentence: 王心念口言，作師子吼：『我當十二年中，當供養五眾，乃至辦諸供具。』
translation: The king thought to himself and said, 'For 12 years, I will make a lion's roar, saying, 'Should I make offerings to the five groups of people or even prepare all the offerings?'

source_sentence: 即便行施，行施之日，天當降香澤之雨，遍閻浮提，一切實種皆得增長。
translation: On the day he gives, the gods will send down rain of fragrant water to pervade Jambudvīpa, and all the real seeds will grow.

source_sentence: 諸方人眾皆持供養，來詣拘睒彌國，供養眾僧。
translation: The people of all directions made offerings and came to the country of Kauśāmbī to make offerings to the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 「時，諸比丘大得供養。
translation: At the time, the monks had greatly received offerings.

source_sentence: 諸比丘輩食人信施，而不讀誦經書，不薩闍為人受經。
translation: The monks who ate the food believed in giving, didn't read and recite sūtras or books, and didn't accept the sūtras for someone to receive them.

source_sentence: 戲論過日，眠臥終夜，貪著利養，好自嚴飾，身著妙服，離諸出要、寂靜、出家、三菩提樂。
translation: When the day has passed, he sleeps and lays up all through the night longing for gain and pleasure. He enjoys self-adornment and wears beautiful clothes to keep himself free of the three defilements: renunciation, tranquility, renunciation, and the bliss of enlightenment.

source_sentence: 形類比丘，離沙門功德，是法中之大賊，助作末世壞正法幢，建惡魔幢，
translation: A bhikṣu like this is free of the merits of śramaṇas. This is a great thief in the dharma who helps to make the bad dharma-banner and the bad Māra-banner for the sake of the destruction of the right dharma in the latter half of the world.

source_sentence: 滅正法炬，然煩惱火，壞正法鼓，毀正法輪，消正法海，壞正法山，破正法城，
translation: The torch of the right teaching is extinguished, but the fire of defilement burns the drum of the right teaching. It destroys the wheel of the right teaching, annihilates the ocean of the right teaching, disintegrates the mountain of the right teaching, and breaks up the city of the right teaching.

source_sentence: 拔正法樹，毀禪定智慧，斷戒瓔珞，污染正道。
translation: He uprooted the true dharma tree, disparaged meditation and wisdom, cut off the necklace of precepts, and polluted the right path.

source_sentence: 「時，彼天、龍、鬼神、夜叉、乾闥婆等，於諸比丘所生惡意，毀訾諸比丘，
translation: “At the time, those gods, dragons, ghosts, yakṣas, and gandharvas had bad intentions toward the monks and disparaged them.

source_sentence: 厭惡、遠離，不復相親，異口同音：『嗚呼！
translation: They become disgusted, seclusioned, and no longer associate with each other.

source_sentence: 如是惡比丘，不應於如來法中。』
translation: Such a bad monk shouldn't follow the Tathāgata's teaching.'

source_sentence: 「『非吉行惡行，　　行諸邪見法，
translation: 'It's not auspicious to do bad actions, wrong views, and wrong views.

source_sentence: 此諸愚癡人，　　打壞正法山，
translation: These foolish people Destroyed the true mountain of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 行諸惡戒法，　　棄諸如法行，
translation: They practice bad precepts and rules, Forsake the ways that accord with truth.

source_sentence: 捨諸勝妙法，　　拔除今佛法，
translation: Rejecting the supreme and sublime teachings, They remove the present Buddha-teachings.

source_sentence: 不信不調伏，　　樂行諸惡行，
translation: Not believing and not being disciplined, they delight in bad behavior.

source_sentence: 諂偽誑世間，　　打破牟尼法，
translation: The world of hypocrisy and deceitfulness breaks the teaching of the sage.

source_sentence: 毀形習諸惡，　　兇暴及千行，
translation: Disparaging one’s form and accumulating evil, Being violent and acting in a thousand ways.

source_sentence: 依法誑世人，　　忿恨自貢高，
translation: The Dharma is harmful to the people of the world, and they blame themselves for being arrogant in anger.

source_sentence: 貪著求名利，　　無惡業不備，
translation: They are addicted to seeking fame and profit, And have no evil deeds that aren’t fulfilled.

source_sentence: 如佛所說法，　　法沒有是相，
translation: Just as the Buddha teaches, The Dharma has no such characteristics:

source_sentence: 今者悉已見，　　智者所輕賤，
translation: Now they have all seen that the wise are despised.

source_sentence: 此法今出已，　　牟尼正法海，
translation: Now that this teaching has emerged, the Sage’s ocean of true teaching

source_sentence: 不久當枯竭，　　正法今少在，
translation: Soon it will soon wither, But the true teaching is scarcely to be found.

source_sentence: 惡人復來滅，　　毀壞我正法。』
translation: Bad people will again come to cease and disparage my right teaching.'

source_sentence: 而說偈言：「時，彼諸天、龍、神等皆生不歡喜心，不復當護諸比丘，
translation: He said in verse, At that time, those gods, dragons, and spirits all became disheartened. They will no longer protect the monks.

source_sentence: 而同聲唱言：『佛法却後七日滅盡。』
translation: They all cried out in unison, saying, 'Seven days after the Buddha's teaching has departed, it will cease.'

source_sentence: 號咷悲泣，共相謂言：『至比丘說戒日，共相鬪諍，如來正法於中而滅。』
translation: They wailed and cried out in pity, saying to each other, 'On the day when the monk explained the precepts, they all had a dispute with each other, and the Tathāgata's right teaching ceased there.'

source_sentence: 如是諸天悲惱啼泣。
translation: Thus, the gods are grieved and weep.

source_sentence: 「時，拘睒彌城中有五百優婆塞，聞諸天之言，共詣諸比丘眾中，諫諸比丘鬪諍，
translation: “At that time, five hundred laymen in the city of Kauśāmbī heard the words of the gods and went together with the assembly of monks to exhort the bhikṣus who were engaged in disputes.

source_sentence: 「『嗚呼苦劇歲，　　愍念群生生，
translation: 'Ahoy, when it's a year of suffering and distress, I pity all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 其法今便滅，　　釋師子王法，
translation: That teaching will now cease, and the Dharma of the lion-king of the Śākyas.

source_sentence: 惡輪壞法輪，　　如是盡金剛，
translation: The wheel of evil destroys the wheel of truth, and thus he ends the adamantine.

source_sentence: 乃能不即壞，　　安隱時已滅，
translation: They are able not to disintegrate immediately, Having ceased at the time of peace.

source_sentence: 危險法已起，　　明智人已過，
translation: Dangerous dharmas have already arisen, and the wise man of insight has gone beyond them.

source_sentence: 今見如是相，　　當知不復久，
translation: Having seen such signs now, you should know that it won’t be long.

source_sentence: 牟尼法斷滅，　　世間無復明，
translation: The teaching of the Sage is cut off, and there’s no more light in the world.

source_sentence: 離垢寂滅口，　　牟尼日今沒，
translation: The mouth that’s free from defilement and tranquil, the sun of the Sage has now disappeared.

source_sentence: 世人失伏藏，　　善惡無差別，
translation: People in the world lose their treasury of subjugation, Good and evil are not different.

source_sentence: 善惡無差已，　　誰能得正覺，
translation: Who can attain perfect enlightenment without distinction between good and evil?

source_sentence: 法燈今在世，　　及時行諸善，
translation: Now that the lamp of the Dharma is in the world, he does good deeds at the right time.

source_sentence: 無量諸福田，　　此法今當滅，
translation: Innumerable fields of blessings: This teaching will now perish.

source_sentence: 是故我等輩，　　知財不堅牢，
translation: Because of this, we know that our wealth is not stable.

source_sentence: 及時取堅實。』
translation: Take it at the right time and make sure it's firm.'

source_sentence: 而說偈言：「至十五日說戒時，法當沒，今日五百優婆塞，一日之中，
translation: He said in verse: On the fifteenth day of the month, when the precepts are taught, the dharma will perish. Today, five hundred laymen (i.e., monks and nuns) have been observing the precepts for one day.

source_sentence: 造五百佛塔。
translation: He built five hundred stūpas for the Buddha.

source_sentence: 時，諸優婆塞各有餘務，不復來往眾僧眾中。
translation: Each of the laymen then had other duties, so they didn't go back or forth among the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 「爾時，住揵陀摩羅山修羅他阿羅漢觀閻浮提：『今日何處有眾僧說戒？』

source_sentence: 見有拘睒彌國如來弟子說戒為布薩，即詣拘睒彌。
translation: Seeing a tathāgata disciple of the Tathāgata in Kauśāmbī who taught the precepts as a bodhisattva, he went to Kauśāmbī.

source_sentence: 「時，彼僧眾乃有百千人，中唯有一阿羅漢，名曰修羅他。

source_sentence: 又復有一三藏，名曰弟子，此是如來最後大眾集。
translation: Again, there is another Tripiṭaka called the “disciple.” This is the last assembly of the great assembly attended by the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 爾時，維那行舍羅籌，白三藏上座言：『眾僧已集，有百千人，今為說波羅提木叉。』
translation: It was then that Vairocana practiced the śāla and said to the saṃgha of the Tripiṭaka, 'There are hundreds of thousands of monks who have gathered here, so now I'll explain the prātimokṣa.'

source_sentence: 時，彼上座答言：『閻浮提如來弟子皆來集此，數有百千。
translation: The superior monk replied, 'There are hundreds of thousands of disciples of the Tathāgata from Jambudvīpa who have come to this place.

source_sentence: 如是眾中，我為上首，了達三藏，尚不學戒律，況復餘者而有所學。
translation: I am the leader of this assembly. Having mastered the Tripitaka Master, I have not studied the precepts and vinaya; how much less should anyone else study them.

source_sentence: 今當為誰而說戒律？』
translation: Who will I now explain the precepts for?'

source_sentence: 「『今是十五日，　　夜靜月清明，
translation: 'Now it's the fifteenth day, when the night is still and the moon is clear.

source_sentence: 如是諸比丘，　　今集聽說戒，
translation: Thus, these monks have now assembled to listen to the precepts.

source_sentence: 一切閻浮提，　　眾僧最後集，
translation: All the saṃgha in Jambudvfpa Have gathered together for the last time.

source_sentence: 我是眾中上，　　不學戒律法，
translation: I am the best among beings in the assembly, not training in the precepts or the Dharma.

source_sentence: 況復餘僧眾，　　而有所學習，
translation: How much more so for the rest of the sangha, Who have some learning to do.

source_sentence: 何能牟尼法，　　釋迦師子王，
translation: How could the saintly Dharma King Śākyamuni, the lion king of the lion,

source_sentence: 彼戒誰有持，　　是人乃能說。』
translation: Who upholds those precepts, and it's someone who can teach them.'

source_sentence: 而說偈言：「爾時，彼阿羅漢修羅他立上座前，合掌白上座言：『上座！

source_sentence: 但說波羅提木叉，如佛在世時，舍利弗、目揵連等大比丘眾所學法，我今已悉學。
translation: He simply explained the prātimokṣa, just as when the Buddha was in the world, Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana were among the great monks who studied the teachings while he was there, and now I've studied them all.

source_sentence: 如來雖滅度，於今已千歲，彼所制律儀，我悉已備足。』
translation: Although the Tathāgata has ceased and passed away, it's a thousand years old now, and I'm fully equipped with the restraints they prescribe.'

source_sentence: 「『上座聽我說，　　我名修羅他，
translation: 'The superior monk listens to my explanation, and I'm called a sūtra master.

source_sentence: 漏盡阿羅漢，　　僧中師子吼。
translation: An arhat whose contaminants have ended is the lion's roar among the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 牟尼真弟子，　　信佛諸鬼神，
translation: The disciples of the sage Muni truly believe in the buddhas, ghosts, and spirits.

source_sentence: 聞彼聖所說，　　悲哀泣流淚。
translation: Hearing what the sage teaches, they weep and shed tears of sorrow.

source_sentence: 低頭念法滅，　　從今去已後，
translation: The thought of the doctrine with a low head is extinguished. From this moment onward,

translation: There's no one who teaches the Dharma, and there's a specific liberation of vinaya.

source_sentence: 不復在於世，　　法橋今已壞，
translation: They will no longer be in the world. The bridge of the Teaching has now been destroyed.

source_sentence: 法水不復流，　　法海已枯竭。
translation: The water of the Dharma doesn't flow again, and the ocean of the Dharma has dried up.

source_sentence: 法山已崩頹，　　法會從今絕，
translation: The mountain of the Teaching has already crumbled, And the assembly of the Teaching will henceforth be cut off.

source_sentence: 法幢不復見，　　法足不復行。
translation: The banner of the Dharma is no longer seen, and the feet of the Dharma are no longer practiced.

source_sentence: 律儀戒永沒，　　法燈不復照，
translation: Restraint and precepts are permanently gone, And the lamp of truth no longer shines.

source_sentence: 法輪不復轉，　　閉塞甘露門。
translation: The wheel of the Dharma doesn't turn again, shutting off the ambrosia gate.

source_sentence: 法師不在世，　　善人說妙道，
translation: The teacher of the Dharma is not in the world, but a good person teaches the wonderful path.

source_sentence: 眾生不識善，　　不異於野獸。』
translation: Sentient beings don't know goodness, and they aren't different from wild animals.'

source_sentence: 苦哉！
translation: How painful!

source_sentence: 是我之子經歷阿僧祇劫，修諸苦行，不顧勞體，積德成佛，今者忽然消滅。』
translation: After incalculably long eons of cultivating painful practices, this son of mine didn't care about his body and accumulated virtue to become a buddha, but now he suddenly ceases.'

source_sentence: 「『我是佛親母，　　我子積苦行，
translation: 'I am the Buddha's mother, and my child accumulates ascetic practices.

source_sentence: 經歷無數劫，　　究竟成真道。
translation: After innumerable kalpas passed, they ultimately accomplished the true path.

source_sentence: 悲泣不自勝，　　今法忽磨滅，
translation: Their sorrow and weeping cannot overcome themselves, but now the Dharma suddenly disappears.

source_sentence: 嗚呼智慧人，　　爾今何所在。
translation: Whoops, wise man! Where are you now?

source_sentence: 持法捨諍訟，　　從佛口所生，
translation: They preserve the Dharma and abandon disputes, Arising from the Buddha’s mouth.

source_sentence: 諸王無上尊，　　真實佛弟子。
translation: The kings are the supreme honored ones, true disciples of the Buddha.

source_sentence: 頭陀修妙行，　　宿止林藪間，
translation: The ascetic practiced his wondrous deeds and spent the night in a forest or grove.

source_sentence: 如是真佛子，　　今為何所在。
translation: Such is the true Buddha-child, Where is he now?

source_sentence: 今者於世間，　　無有諸威德，
translation: At the present time, there are no awesome virtues In the world.

source_sentence: 曠野山林間，　　諸神寂無言。
translation: In the wilderness, between mountains and forests, The spirits are silent without words.

source_sentence: 施戒愍群生，　　信戒自莊嚴，
translation: Giving and morality pity sentient beings, Faith and morality self-adorn themselves.

source_sentence: 忍辱質直行，　　觀察諸善惡。
translation: He practices with forbearance and straightforwardness, observing good and evil.

source_sentence: 如是諸勝法，　　今忽都已盡。』
translation: Such excellent qualities as these have suddenly ended now.'

source_sentence: 而說偈言：「爾時，彼上座弟子作是念言：『彼修羅他比丘自言：「如來所制戒律，
translation: He said in verse, At that point, the superior disciple had this thought, saying, 'That sūratha monk said to himself, The precepts established by the Tathāgata

source_sentence: 我悉備持。」』
translation: I'll fully maintain them.'

source_sentence: 爾時，上座有弟子，名曰安伽陀，起不忍之心，極生忿恨。
translation: At the time, the superior monk had a disciple named Anāthapiṇḍada, who became unable to bear it and became extremely angry.

source_sentence: 從座起，罵辱彼聖：『汝是下座比丘，愚癡無智，而毀辱我和上。』
translation: He rose from his seat and insulted the sage, saying, 'You're a junior monk, foolish and ignorant, disgracing me and the superior.'

source_sentence: 「『我名安伽陀，　　失沙之弟子，
translation: 'My name is Anāthapiṇḍada, and I'm a disciple who lost the sand.

source_sentence: 利劍殺汝身，　　自謂我有德。』
translation: I killed you with a sharp sword and said to myself, 'I have virtue.'

source_sentence: 即持利刀，殺彼聖人，而說偈言：「爾時，有一鬼名曰大提木佉，作是念言：『世間唯有此一阿羅漢，
translation: He then took a sharp sword, killed the holy man, and said in verse, At that time there was a demon named Mahāmaudgalyāyana who had this thought:

source_sentence: 而為惡比丘弟子所害。』
translation: They'll be harmed by a disciple of a bad monk.'

source_sentence: 「『我是惡鬼神，　　名大提木佉，
translation: 'This is a bad demon spirit named Datimukha,

translation: With this vajra, I'll break seven parts of your head with it.'

source_sentence: 執持金剛利杵，杵頭火然，以此打破彼頭，即便命終，而說偈言：「爾時，

source_sentence: 阿羅漢弟子見彼弟子殺害其師，忿恨不忍，即殺三藏。
translation: When the arhat disciple saw that disciple kill his teacher, he became angry and couldn't bear it, so he killed the Tripiṭaka.

source_sentence: 爾時，諸天、世人悲哀啼泣：『嗚呼！
translation: At that point, the gods and people of the world cried out in sorrow, 'Ahoy!

source_sentence: 苦哉！
translation: How painful!

source_sentence: 如來正法今便都盡。』
translation: Now, the Tathāgata's right teaching is completely exhausted.'

source_sentence: 尋即此大地六種震動，無量眾生號咷啼泣，極為愁惱：『嗚呼！
translation: That is, the earth shakes in six ways, and measureless sentient beings wail and weep, extremely sadly: 'Ahoy!

source_sentence: 今日正法不復現世。』
translation: Today, the right teaching won't reappear in the world.'

source_sentence: 作是語已，各各離散。
translation: After they said these words, each of them dispersed.

source_sentence: 「爾時，拘睒彌國五百優婆塞聞已，往詣寺中，舉手拍頭，高聲大哭：『嗚呼！
translation: After hearing this, the five hundred laymen of Kauśāmbī went to the temple, raised their hands and patted their heads, weeping loudly, 'Ahoy!

source_sentence: 如來愍念世間，濟諸群生，無有巨細，誰當為我說法義？
translation: The Tathāgata has compassion for the world and saves all sentient beings. There is no greater or lesser, so who could teach me the meaning of the Dharma?

source_sentence: 今者，人、天解脫不復可得，眾生今日猶在闇瞑，無有引導，長習諸惡，
translation: Now the liberation of humans and gods cannot be obtained again. Today living beings are still in darkness, without a guide, perpetually engaged in various evil deeds.

source_sentence: 以此為歡，如諸野獸；
translation: Because of this they become joyous, like wild animals.

source_sentence: 不聞牟尼妙法，身壞命終，墮在三塗。
translation: If they don't hear the wonderful teaching of Muni, they'll fall into the three destinies when their body breaks up and their life ends.

source_sentence: 譬如流星，世人從今已後，無復念慧、寂靜、三昧、十力妙法。』
translation: It's like a rushing star, for which the world no longer has mindfulness of wisdom, quiescence, concentration, and the marvelous Dharma of the ten powers from now on.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，拘睒彌王聞諸比丘殺真人阿羅漢及三藏法師，心生悲惱，惋慨而坐。
translation: At the time, King Kauśāmbī heard that the monks killed the arhats and tripiṭaka masters of the Mahāprajñāpāramitā as well as the arhats and Tripiṭaka Masters, and his mind became sad and distressed, grieved, and sat down.

source_sentence: 爾時，諸邪見輩諍競打破塔廟，及害比丘，從是佛法索然頓滅。」
translation: At the time, various wrong views and groups of people vied with each other to break down a stūpa or temple and harm a monk, and this is how the Buddha's teaching suddenly ceased.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊語釋提桓因：「四大天王，諸天、世人於我滅度之後，法盡之相，
translation: At that time the World-honored One said to Śakra Devānām-Indra: O great lord of the fourfold heavenly kings! After my nirvana, all the gods and humans in the world will see the end of their dharmas.

source_sentence: 如上所說。
translation: It's as explained above.

source_sentence: 是故汝等，今者不可不以勤力加於精進，護持正法，久令在世。」
translation: That's why you mustn't fail to apply your diligence and effort, uphold the right teaching, and keep it in the world for a long time.

source_sentence: 爾時，諸天、世人聞佛所說，各各悲顏，以手揮淚，頂禮佛足，各自退去。
translation: At that time, having heard the Buddha’s exhortation, the gods and humans each grieved in distress. They raised their hands to shed tears, bowed at the Buddha’s feet, and withdrew.

source_sentence: （六四一）阿育王施半阿摩勒果因緣經
translation: (6:41) Sutra on the Causes and Conditions for the Fruit of Aśoka's Half-Amala donation

source_sentence: 阿育王於如來法中得大敬信。
translation: King Aśoka had great respect and faith in the Tathāgata's teaching.

source_sentence: 時，王問諸比丘言：「誰於如來法中行大布施？」
translation: The king then asked the monks, Who is practicing great generosity in the Tathāgata's teaching?

source_sentence: 諸比丘白王言：「給孤獨長者最行大施。」
translation: The monks said to the king, Give it to an orphaned elder who most practices great generosity.

source_sentence: 王復問曰：「彼施幾許寶物？」
translation: Again, the king asked, How much treasure does he give?

source_sentence: 比丘答曰：「以億千金。」
translation: The monk answered, With a hundred million pieces of gold.

source_sentence: 王聞已。
translation: After the king heard this, he said.

source_sentence: 如是思惟：「彼長者尚能捨億千金，我今為王，何緣復以億千金施？
translation: Thus, he thought, That elder could still give away a hundred million pieces of gold, but now that I'm the king, why would I give another hundred million pieces of gold?

source_sentence: 當以億百千金施。」
translation: You will give a hundred million, one hundred thousand pieces of gold.

source_sentence: 時，王起八萬四千佛塔，於彼諸塔中復施百千金，復作五歲大會，會有三百千比丘，
translation: The king then erected eighty-four thousand buddha-tathānas, offered a hundred thousand pieces of gold to each of these stupas, and again convened a five-yearly assembly of three hundred thousand bhikṣus.

source_sentence: 用三百億金供養於彼僧眾中。
translation: He used 300 billion pieces of gold to make offerings to the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 第一分是阿羅漢，第二分是學人，第三分是真實凡夫。
translation: The first part is an arhat, the second part is a trainee, and the third part is a real worldling.

source_sentence: 除私庫藏，此閻浮提夫人、婇女、太子、大臣施與聖僧，四十億金還復贖取。
translation: Except for the private treasury, this Jambudvīpa's wife, court ladies, princes, and ministers gave it to the noble monks, and another four billion pieces of gold were redeemed again.

source_sentence: 如是計挍，用九十六億千金，乃至王得重病時，王自知命欲終盡。
translation: Thus, he calculates the amount of gold that will be spent for nine billion six hundred million li, and when the king becomes seriously ill, the king knows for himself that his life is about to end.

source_sentence: 時，有大臣名羅陀崛多。
translation: At the time, there was a minister named Rāhulagupta.

source_sentence: 時，王宿命是施佛土時同伴小兒。
translation: At the time, the king's constellation was the young boy who was his companion at the time of giving to the Buddha land.

source_sentence: 「顏貌常鮮澤，　　百千婇女遶，
translation: Their features are always pure and lustrous, Surrounded by hundreds of thousands of court ladies.

source_sentence: 譬如諸蓮華，　　蜜蜂當聚集，
translation: It's like lotus flowers, where honey and bees will gather together.

source_sentence: 今覩聖王顏，　　無有諸鮮澤。」
translation: Now, I see the face of the noble king, and there's no such thing as freshness.

source_sentence: 「我今無所憂，　　失財及王位，
translation: “Now I have nothing to worry about, losing my wealth and sovereignty.

source_sentence: 此身及餘親，　　及諸種種寶，
translation: This body, the other relatives, and various treasures.

source_sentence: 我今所愁者，　　不復覩賢聖，
translation: What grieves me now is that I no longer pity the wise and holy.

source_sentence: 四事以供養，　　我今唯念此，
translation: These are the four kinds of offerings that I now remember.

source_sentence: 顏色有變異，　　心意無所寧。
translation: Their appearance has changed, but their minds and thoughts are not at ease.

source_sentence: 時，彼大臣羅陀崛多見王重病，命垂欲盡，稽首以偈問王：王即以偈答：「又復，
translation: Seeing the king seriously ill and dying, he bowed his head in respect and asked the king questions in verse: The king answered in verse:

source_sentence: 我常所願，欲以滿億百千金作功德，今願不得滿足，便就後世時，計挍前後所施金銀珍寶，
translation: My eternal vow is to produce merits worth hundreds of millions of myriads of koṭis of pieces of gold. But now I wish not to fulfill this vow. So, in the time after death, I will calculate the amount of gold, silver, and precious treasures that I have previously and later bestowed on you.

source_sentence: 唯減四億未滿。」
translation: It's only 400 million less than that.

source_sentence: 王即辦諸珍寶，送與鷄雀寺中。
translation: The king then prepared the treasures and presented them to Kukkuṭika Monastery.

source_sentence: 法益之子，名三波提，為太子諸臣等，啟太子言：「大王將終不久，今以此珍寶送與寺舍中，
translation: The son of Fayi, named Sambodhi, addressed the prince and his ministers, “Your majesty, it will not be long before Your Majesty’s demise.

source_sentence: 今庫藏財寶已竭，諸王法以物為尊，太子今宜斷之，勿使大王用盡也。」
translation: Now that the treasury of possessions and treasures has run out, the king's law is to honor things as their treasure; it's advisable for the prince to cut them off now so that the great king won't use them up.

source_sentence: 時，太子即勅典藏者，勿復出與大王用之。
translation: The prince then ordered the treasurer of the treasury not to give it to the king for his use.

source_sentence: 時，大王自知索諸物不復能得，所食金器送與寺中。
translation: Knowing that he couldn't get the things he asked for, the great king gave the gold vessel he ate to the monastery.

source_sentence: 時，太子令斷金器，給以銀器，王食已，復送與寺中。
translation: The prince then ordered the gold vessel to be cut off and given to a silver vessel. Having eaten it, the king again gave it to the monastery.

source_sentence: 又斷銀器，給以銅器，王亦以此送與寺中。
translation: He also cut off the silver vessel and gave it to a copper vessel, and the king gave it to the monastery.

source_sentence: 又斷銅器，給以瓦器。
translation: He also cut off the copper vessel and gave it to the tile vessel.

translation: The great king then had half an amala fruit in his hand, and he wept with pity and told the ministers, Who is the land lord now?

source_sentence: 時，諸臣啟白大王：「王為地主。」
translation: The ministers then asked the great king, The king is the lord of the land.

source_sentence: 「汝等護我心，　　何假虛妄語，
translation: You should protect our minds. Why would you speak falsely?

source_sentence: 我今坐王位，　　不復得自在。
translation: Now that I'm sitting in the king's throne, I won't be able to control it again.

source_sentence: 阿摩勒半果，　　今在於我手，
translation: The amala half-fruit is now in my hand.

source_sentence: 此即是我物，　　於是得自由。
translation: This is my property, and I'll then attain freedom.

source_sentence: 嗚呼尊富貴，　　可厭可棄捨，
translation: Whoops, you're so noble and wealthy that you should be disgusted and abandoned.

source_sentence: 先領閻浮提，　　今一旦貧至。
translation: Formerly he ruled over Jambudvfpa, but now he's once been poor.

source_sentence: 如恒河駛流，　　一逝而不返，
translation: Like the Ganges River, which flows in a steady stream and never retreated even once.

source_sentence: 富貴亦復然，　　逝者不復還。」
translation: The rich and powerful are likewise, but the deceased doesn't return.

source_sentence: 「凡盛必有衰，　　以衰為究竟，
translation: Ordinary beings, when flourishing, necessarily have decay. Decay is the ultimate:

source_sentence: 如來神口說，　　真實無有異，
translation: The Buddha’s spiritual mouth teaches: There is no difference between reality and reality.

source_sentence: 先時所教令，　　速疾無有閡，
translation: What they had previously taught, They quickly and unhinderedly teach.

source_sentence: 今有所求索，　　無復從我教，
translation: Whatever you ask for now, don’t follow my instructions.

source_sentence: 如風閡於山，　　如水閡於岸，
translation: Just as the wind stops at a mountain, So does water stop at the shore.

source_sentence: 我今所教令，　　於今已永絕，
translation: The teachings I teach now Will be forever extinguished.

source_sentence: 將從無量眾，　　擊鼓吹貝螺，
translation: Together with an immeasurable assembly, They beat the drum and blew the conch.

source_sentence: 常作諸伎樂，　　受諸五欲樂，
translation: They always play music and dance, And experience the pleasures of the five senses.

source_sentence: 婇女數百眾，　　日夜自娛樂，
translation: Hundreds of thousands of court ladies Amuse themselves day and night.

source_sentence: 今者都永盡，　　如樹無花實，
translation: Now they are all permanently extinguished, like trees with no flowers or fruits.

source_sentence: 顏貌轉枯盡，　　色力亦復然，
translation: Their countenance becomes increasingly withered, And so is their complexion and strength.

source_sentence: 如花轉萎悴，　　我今亦復爾。」
translation: It's like a flower that becomes withered, and so am I now.

source_sentence: 時，王即說偈答曰：又復，如佛偈所說：時，阿育王呼侍者言：「汝今憶我恩養，
translation: Again, just as the Buddha had said in verse: At that time King Aśoka summoned his attendants and said:

source_sentence: 汝持此半阿摩勒果送鷄雀寺中，作我意，禮拜諸比丘僧足，白言：『阿育王問訊諸大聖眾，
translation: Take this half an amala fruit and send it to the Kukkuṭika Monastery. Having thought of me, you should pay respect at the feet of the bhikṣus and monks in the monastery and say:

source_sentence: 我是阿育王，領此閻浮提，閻浮提是我所有，今者頓盡，無有財寶布施眾僧，
translation: I am King Aśoka, ruling over this Jambudvipa. This Jambudvipa belongs to me. At the present time it is suddenly extinguished and no wealth or treasure can be given to the sangha.

source_sentence: 於一切財而不得自在。
translation: They won't be able to control all their possessions.

source_sentence: 今唯此半阿摩勒果，我得自由，此是最後布施檀波羅蜜，哀愍我故，納受此施，
translation: Only this half-āmalaka fruit will now be given to me freely. This is my last donation of the perfection of charity, for which I am deeply saddened and accept it.

source_sentence: 令我得供養僧福。』
translation: Let me attain the merit of making offerings to the saṃgha.'

source_sentence: 「半阿摩勒果，　　是我之所有，
translation: I own half an amala fruit,

source_sentence: 於我得自在，　　今捨於大眾。
translation: They've attained mastery over me, but now they abandon it to the masses.

source_sentence: 緣心在於聖，　　更無濟我者，
translation: Conditioned by mind, it is in the noble. There is no helper for self.

source_sentence: 憐愍於我故，　　納受阿摩勒。
translation: Because of pity for me, he accepted the amala.

source_sentence: 為我食此施，　　因是福無量，
translation: Eat this gift for my sake because its merit is immeasurable.

source_sentence: 世世受妙樂，　　用之無有盡。」
translation: They receive marvelous bliss from generation to generation, and there's no limit to how they can use it.

source_sentence: 而說偈言：時，彼使者受王勅已，即持此半阿摩勒果，至鷄雀寺中，至上座前，
translation: The messenger, having received the king’s edict, immediately took this half-ounce of amalaka fruit and went to the monastery in front of the superior monk.

source_sentence: 「領於閻浮提，　　一繖繫一鼓，
translation: To rule over Jambudvfpa, they bound one drum with a bell and tossed another drum.

source_sentence: 遊行無所礙，　　如日照於世，
translation: They wander without obstruction, Like the sun shining in the world.

source_sentence: 業行報已至，　　在世不復久，
translation: The karmic retribution has already arrived, and it won’t be long in the world.

source_sentence: 無有王威德，　　如日雲所翳，
translation: There’s no king with mighty virtue, Like the rising sun and its clouds.

source_sentence: 號曰阿育王，　　稽首禮僧足，
translation: His name was King Aśoka, and he bowed his head at the feet of the monks.

source_sentence: 送此布施物，　　謂半阿摩勒，
translation: He sends this gift, which is half an amala,

source_sentence: 願求來世福，　　哀愍彼王故，
translation: May you seek the blessings of future ages Because you have compassion for that king.

source_sentence: 聖眾愍彼故，　　受是半果施。」
translation: Because the noble people pity them, they accept this half-fruit gift.

source_sentence: 五體著地作禮，長跪合掌，向上座而說偈曰：時，彼上座告諸大眾：「誰聞是語而不厭世間？
translation: He bowed his five bodies on the ground, knelt down with joined palms, went up to his seat, and said in verse, The superior seat then addressed the masses, Who wouldn't tire of the world if they heard these words?

source_sentence: 我等聞是事，不可不生厭離，如佛經所說。
translation: We should not give rise to disillusionment when we hear these things, just as the Buddha’s sutra explains.

source_sentence: 見他衰事，應生厭離，若有識類眾生者，聞是事豈得不捨世間？」
translation: Seeing the decline of things in others, they should become disillusioned with them. If there are conscious sentient beings who hear these things, how can they not abandon the world if they hear them?

source_sentence: 「人王世中最，　　阿育孔雀姓，
translation: Among the highest among human kings in the world, Aśoka is a peacock by family.

source_sentence: 閻浮提自在，　　阿摩勒為主，
translation: Jambudvfpa is the sovereign, while Amala is the ruler.

source_sentence: 太子及諸臣，　　共奪大王施，
translation: The prince and his ministers together withdrew the great king's gift,

source_sentence: 送半阿摩勒，　　降伏憍財者，
translation: I'll send half an amala, subdue the coarse treasurer, and give it to you.

source_sentence: 使彼生厭心，　　愚夫不識施，
translation: Causing them to become disillusioned, foolish people don’t know giving.

source_sentence: 因果受妙樂，　　示送半摩勒。」
translation: As a result, they'll experience marvelous bliss and show it to half a man.

source_sentence: 而說偈曰：時，彼上座作是念言：「云何令此半阿摩勒，一切眾僧得其分食？」
translation: He spoke a verse, saying, The superior monk then had this thought, How will this half-āmalaka allow all the saṃgha to get their share of food?

source_sentence: 即教令研磨，著石榴羹中，行已，眾僧一切皆得周遍。
translation: He then instructed them to grind it and put it in a pomegranate soup, and after they did so, all the saṃgha were able to pervade it.

source_sentence: 時，王復問傍臣曰：「誰是閻浮提王？」
translation: The king then again asked his attendants, Who is the king of Jambudvīpa?

source_sentence: 臣啟王言：「大王是也。」
translation: The ministers asked the king, Great king, this is it.

source_sentence: 時，王從臥起而坐，顧望四方，合掌作禮，念諸佛德，心念口言：「我今復以此閻浮提施與三寶，
translation: At that moment, the king rose from his couch and took his seat. Looking in all four directions, he saluted the buddhas with joined palms and bowed to them. Thinking of the virtues of the buddhas, he thought mentally and verbally, “I will now give this Jambudvlpa as an offering to the Three Jewels.

source_sentence: 隨意用之。」
translation: Use it as you wish.

source_sentence: 「今此閻浮提，　　多有珍寶飾，
translation: “Now this continent of Jambudvfpa Is richly decorated with treasures and jewels.

source_sentence: 施與良福田，　　果報自然得，
translation: Giving to a good field of merit will naturally bring rewards.

source_sentence: 以此施功德，　　不求天帝釋，
translation: Because of this merit of giving, they don't seek Indra, the lord of gods,

source_sentence: 梵王及人主，　　世界諸妙樂，
translation: Brahmā and the lord of humans, The marvelous bliss of the world:

source_sentence: 如是等果報，　　我悉不用受，
translation: Such consequences as these I do not experience at all.

source_sentence: 以是施功德，　　疾得成佛道，
translation: Because of this merit of giving, they’ll quickly attain the buddha path.

source_sentence: 為世所尊仰，　　成得一切智，
translation: Being honored by the world, they attain omniscience.

source_sentence: 世間作善友，　　導師最第一。」
translation: Being a good friend in the world, the guide is the best.

source_sentence: 而說偈曰：時，王以此語盡書紙上，而封緘之，以齒印印之。
translation: He spoke a verse, saying, At the time, the king wrote these words all on paper and sealed them with his teeth and seals.

source_sentence: 作如是事畢，便即就盡。
translation: After doing such a thing, he'll immediately end it.

source_sentence: 爾時，太子及諸臣、宮人、婇女、國界人民，興種種供養葬送，如王之法而闍維之。
translation: At the time, the prince and his ministers, palace officials, court ladies, and people of the kingdom made various offerings and buried him in accordance with the king's rules.

source_sentence: 爾時，諸臣欲立太子紹王位，中有一大臣，名曰阿[少\/兔]羅陀，語諸臣曰：「不得立太子為王。
translation: At the time, when the ministers wanted to appoint Prince Shao as king, there was a minister named [lesser\/rabbit] Luoda among them who said to the ministers, You mustn't make the prince king.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 大王阿育在時，本誓願滿十萬億金作諸功德，唯減四億，不滿十萬，以是故，
translation: While the great king Aśoka was there, his original vow to fulfill the merits of one hundred thousand myriads of koṭis of gold creations amounted to less than four hundred million and did not exceed one hundred thousand.

source_sentence: 今捨閻浮提施與三寶，欲令滿足。
translation: Now, I'll abandon Jambudvīpa and give it to the Three Treasures, wanting to make them complete.

source_sentence: 今是大地屬於三寶，云何而立為王？」
translation: Now that the earth belongs to the Three Treasures, how could it be established as king?

source_sentence: 時，諸臣聞已，即送四億諸金，送與寺中，即便立法益之子為王，名三波提。
translation: When the ministers heard this, they sent 400 million pieces of gold and gave it to the monastery, and then the son of Dharmagupta became king named Sambodhi.

source_sentence: 次復太子，名毘梨訶波低，為紹王位，毘梨訶波低太子，名曰毘梨訶西那，
translation: The prince Virūḍhaka, whose name was Vaiśravaṇa, assumed the throne of kingship.

source_sentence: 次紹王位。
translation: Next, he assumed the throne of king.

source_sentence: 毘梨訶西那太子，名曰沸沙須摩，次紹王位。
translation: The prince Vaiśravaṇa, named Puṣkarasuma, succeeded to the throne of kingship.

source_sentence: 沸沙須摩太子，名曰沸沙蜜多羅，次紹王位。
translation: The prince Puṣyamitra, named Puṣyamitra, succeeded to the throne of kingship.

source_sentence: 時，沸沙蜜多羅問諸臣曰：「我當作何等事，令我名德久存於世？」
translation: Bodhidharma then asked the ministers, What will I do to keep my name and virtue in the world for a long time?

source_sentence: 時，賢善諸臣信樂三寶者，啟王言：「阿育大王是王之前種姓，彼王在世，
translation: Good men and gentlemen, who believed in the Triple Gem, said to the king, “Your majesty, great king Aśoka, you were born into a royal family before me.

source_sentence: 造立八萬四千如來塔，復興種種供養，此之名德，相傳至今。
translation: He built eighty-four thousand stupas of the Tathāgata and restored various kinds of offerings. This name and virtue will be transmitted to the present.

source_sentence: 王欲求此名者，當造立八萬四千塔，及諸供養。」
translation: If the king wants to seek this name, he'll build 84,000 stūpas and offerings.

source_sentence: 王言：「大王阿育有大威德，能辦此事，我不能作，更思餘事。」
translation: The king said, Great king Aśoka has great authority and virtue to handle this matter; I can't do it but think of other things.

source_sentence: 中有惡臣，不信向者，啟王言：「世間二種法傳世不滅，一者作善，二者作惡。
translation: There was an evil minister among them who didn't believe in the donor and asked the king, saying, Two kinds of worldly dharmas are transmitted to the world without ceasing, one is to do good and two are to do evil.

source_sentence: 大王阿育作諸善行，王今當行惡行，打壞八萬四千塔。」
translation: The great king Aśoka did good deeds, but now the king will do bad deeds and destroy 84,000 stūpas.

source_sentence: 時，王用侫臣語，即興四兵眾，往詣寺舍，壞諸塔寺。
translation: Using the words of his ministers, the king summoned four army troops and went to a monastery to destroy the stūpas and temples.

source_sentence: 王先往鷄雀寺中，寺門前有石師子，即作師子吼。
translation: The king had previously gone to the monastery of Kukkuṭika, where there was a stone lion in front of the monk’s entrance. He roared the lion’s roar.

source_sentence: 王聞之即大驚怖，非生獸之類，而能吼鳴，還入城中。
translation: When the king heard this, he was greatly frightened and didn't belong to animals that were born but could roar and enter the city.

source_sentence: 如是再三，欲壞彼寺。
translation: He repeated it three times in this way, wanting to destroy that temple.

source_sentence: 時，王呼諸比丘來，問諸比丘：「使我壞塔為善？
translation: The king then summoned the monks to come and asked the monks, Is it good for me to destroy the stūpa?

source_sentence: 壞僧房為善？」
translation: Is it good to destroy the saṃgha's room?

source_sentence: 比丘答曰：「二不應行。
translation: The monk answered, Two shouldn't be done.

source_sentence: 王其欲壞者，寧壞僧房，勿壞佛塔。」
translation: If the king wants to destroy it, he'd better destroy the monks' quarters and not the Buddha's stūpa.

source_sentence: 時，王殺害比丘，及壞塔寺。
translation: The king then killed the monk and destroyed the stūpa and temple.

source_sentence: 如是漸漸至婆伽羅國，又復唱令：「若有人能得沙門釋子頭來者，賞之千金。」
translation: Thus, he gradually arrived in the country of Bhagavān and again called out, If someone can get the head of the ascetic or Śākyamuni to come, they'll be rewarded with a thousand pieces of gold.

source_sentence: 爾時，彼國中有一阿羅漢，化作眾多比丘頭，與諸百姓，令送至於王所，
translation: At the time, there was an arhat in that country who had transformed himself into the heads of many monks. He gave them to the people and ordered them to be taken to the king’s place.

source_sentence: 令王庫藏財寶竭盡。
translation: He caused the king's treasury to run out of treasure and possessions.

source_sentence: 時，彼王聞阿羅漢作如是事，倍復瞋恚，欲殺彼阿羅漢。
translation: When the king heard that the arhat had done such a thing, he became even more angry and wanted to kill the arhat.

source_sentence: 時，彼羅漢入滅盡正受，王作無量方便，殺彼聖人，終不能得。
translation: At the time, that arhat entered into extinction and righteousness, and the king did measureless skillful means to kill that noble person, but he couldn't get it.

source_sentence: 入滅盡三昧力故，不傷其體。
translation: Because of the power of entering cessation samādhi, they won't harm their bodies.

source_sentence: 如是漸進至佛塔門邊。
translation: Thus, he gradually advances to the side of the gate of the Buddha's stūpa.

source_sentence: 彼所塔中，有一鬼神，止住其中，守護佛塔，名曰牙齒。
translation: In the stūpa there was a spirit named Teeth, who lived in it and guarded the Buddha’s stūpa.

source_sentence: 彼鬼神作是念：「我是佛弟子，受持禁戒，不殺害眾生，我今不能殺害於王。」
translation: That ghost thought, I'm a disciple of the Buddha who observes the forbidden precepts and doesn't kill sentient beings, so now I can't kill the king.

source_sentence: 又復作念：「有一神名曰為蟲，行諸惡行，兇暴勇健，求索我女，我不與之；
translation: Again, he thought to himself: There is a deity named worm. He engages in evil activities and is fierce and brave.

source_sentence: 今者為護正法故，當嫁與彼，令其守護佛法。」
translation: Now, for the sake of protecting the right teaching, I will marry them and cause them to guard the Buddha's teaching.

source_sentence: 即呼彼神語言：「我今嫁女與汝，然共立約誓，汝要當降伏此王，勿使興諸惡行，
translation: He then summoned the goddess and said to her, “I will now marry my daughter to you. Yet we have made a common vow: You must subdue this king and not allow him to commit any evil deeds.

source_sentence: 壞滅正法。」
translation: It destroys the right teaching.

source_sentence: 時，王所有一大鬼神，名曰烏茶，威德具足，故彼神不奈王何。
translation: At the time, there was a great demon spirit named Udra possessed by the king and endowed with authority and virtue, so that spirit couldn't help the king.

source_sentence: 時，牙齒神作方便，今日王威勢自然由此鬼神，我今誘誑共作親厚。
translation: At the time, the teeth goddess did this as a method, and today the king's authority is naturally due to these ghosts and spirits, so now I'm encouraging them to become intimate with me.

source_sentence: 如是與彼神作知識，極作知識已，即將此神至於南方大海中。
translation: Thus, they'll become intimate with that spirit, and after becoming intimate, they'll take this spirit to the southern ocean.

source_sentence: 時彼蟲神排攩大山，推迮王上，及四兵眾，無不死盡。
translation: The insect spirit then flew out of the great mountain and pushed the king, his four soldiers, and none of them died.

source_sentence: 眾人唱言：「快哉！
translation: The crowd called out, How wonderful!

source_sentence: 快哉！」
translation: How wonderful!

source_sentence: 是世人相傳，名為快哉。
translation: This is a tradition handed down by people in the world, and it's called bliss.

source_sentence: 彼王終亡，孔雀苗裔於此永終，是故世間富樂不足為貪。
translation: That king died, and the seedlings of the peacock will always die here; therefore, wealth and happiness in the world aren't enough for craving.

source_sentence: 阿育大王有智之人，覺世無常，身命難保，五家財物亦如幻化。
translation: The great king Aśoka, a wise man, perceived that the world was impermanent and his body and life were incapable of being preserved. All the property belonging to the five kinds of households also appeared like magical emanations.

source_sentence: 覺了彼法，勤行精進，作諸功德，乃至臨終，係心三寶，念念不絕，無所悋惜，
translation: Having perceived those teachings, they diligently practiced and exerted themselves in performing virtuous deeds. At the end of their lives they remained mindful of the Three Treasures, never ceasing to do so; they cherished no desire for anything.

source_sentence: 唯願盡成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。
translation: They simply wish to attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 雜阿含經卷第二十五
translation: Saṃyuktâgama-sūtra, Volume 25
